evidence.source_document: Complaint

add_extracted.value: NEH terminated grants without following statutory procedures and required notice.

evidence.text: "On April 3, 2025, 145 NEH staff members—making up 80% of the staff—were placed on administrative leave"
evidence.source_document: Complaint

add_extracted.value: NEH staff were placed on administrative leave; 145 staff (80%) were removed.

evidence.source_document: Complaint

event.doc_name: Amended Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief
Amended Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief

evidence.text: 30, 2025, NEH grant recipients including the Federation, Oregon Humanities, and the Federation’s members, received emails from the NEH Office of Grant Management.
evidence.source_document: Amended Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief

add_extracted.value: NEH grant recipients including the Federation, Oregon Humanities, and the Federation’s members received emails from the NEH Office of Grant Management on 30, 2025.

evidence.text: The email stated that NEH terminated awards in 2025 and attached “Guidance for Recipients of Terminated NEH Awards.”
evidence.source_document: Amended Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief

add_extracted.value: The email stated that NEH terminated awards in 2025 and attached “Guidance for Recipients of Terminated NEH Awards.”

evidence.text: The guidance provided a process for councils to submit for “termination costs” associated with terminated grants, defined as “those [costs] incurred as a direct result of termination and must be necessary and reasonable to ensure an orderly shut‑down of award activities” as well as “closeout costs,” administrative costs associated with the closeout of a terminated award.
evidence.source_document: Amended Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief

add_extracted.value: Guidance provided a process for councils to submit for “termination costs” associated with terminated grants, defined as costs incurred as a direct result of termination and necessary to ensure an orderly shut‑down of award activities, and also defined “closeout costs.”

evidence.text: The April 30th guidance required Plaintiffs to submit complicated and atypical vouchers outside the typical NEH process.
evidence.source_document: Amended Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief

add_extracted.value: The April 30th guidance required Plaintiffs to submit complicated and atypical vouchers outside the typical NEH process.

evidence.text: On June 2, 2025, the then-director of Fed/State, Karen Kenton, sent an email to the Federation and its members titled “FY25 GOS Awards: terminations have been rescinded up to 20 percent.”
evidence.source_document: Amended Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief

add_extracted.value: On June 2, 2025, the then‑director of Fed/State, Karen Kenton, sent an email titled “FY25 GOS Awards: terminations have been rescinded up to 20 percent.”

evidence.text: Congress mandated funding to the state and jurisdictional humanities councils of $65 million in the March 2025 CR and of $65 million in the Fiscal Year 2024 appropriations bill.
evidence.source_document: Amended Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief

add_extracted.value: Congress mandated funding to state and jurisdictional humanities councils of $65 million in the March 2025 CR and of $65 million in the Fiscal Year 2024 appropriations bill.

evidence.text: The Trump Administration’s wholesale dismantling of NEH, near elimination of the Fed/State Office, termination of nearly all previously approved general operating support grants, termination of nearly all competitive and special initiative grants, and cancellation of numerous programs moving forward has caused and continues to cause Plaintiffs serious, irreparable harm.
evidence.source_document: Amended Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief

add_extracted.value: Trump Administration dismantled NEH, near elimination of Fed/State Office, termination of nearly all previously approved general operating support grants, termination of nearly all competitive and special initiative grants, and cancellation of numerous programs.

evidence.text: Many grant applications are “stuck” in process at NEH, which upon information and belief is no longer processing standard operating grants because it lacks the staff to do so.
evidence.source_document: Amended Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief

add_extracted.value: Many grant applications are stuck in process at NEH and are no longer processing standard operating grants.

evidence.text: For example, a $30,000 grant directly to the Federation to support capacity building for councils’ data and evaluation needs, including support for an in‑person consultation with data and evaluation experts, was approved and then cancelled.
evidence.source_document: Amended Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief

add_extracted.value: Example: a $30,000 grant directly to the Federation to support capacity building was approved and then cancelled.

evidence.text: The Federation was invited to apply for a much larger $500,000 Cooperative Agreement grant with NEH’s Office of Data & Evaluation for a three‑year, multi‑phased project to support the Federation’s hiring of consultants to train councils in data gathering and evaluation methodology, as well as to support a new online platform to support councils.  The Cooperative Agreement and budget were drafted in conjunction with NEH staff before DOGE arrived at NEH.
evidence.source_document: Amended Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief

add_extracted.value: Example: a $500,000 Cooperative Agreement grant with NEH’s Office of Data & Evaluation was drafted in conjunction with NEH staff before DOGE arrival.

evidence.text: The Federation has also been damaged by the councils’ inability to pay Federation dues because of funding cuts. Overall, the Federation has lost approximately 27% of its member‑approved 2025 budget.
evidence.source_document: Amended Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief

add_extracted.value: Federation has been damaged by inability to pay dues because of funding cuts and has lost approximately 27% of its 2025 budget.
